block.p: Laura Isabelle Weintraub, a daughter of Janet T. Weintraub of Stamford, Conn., and the late Henry M. Weintraub, was married last evening to Scott David Beck, a son of Vilma R. Beck of Monroe, Conn., and Gilbert A. Beck of Stamford. Rabbi Sharon L. Sobel officiated at Tappan Hill in Tarrytown, N.Y.

Mrs. Beck, 29, graduated from Trinity College in Hartford, received a master's degree in public policy from Harvard University and, in May, received a law degree from Columbia University. Next month she is to become an associate at Willkie Farr & Gallagher, the New York law firm. Her father was the president and chief executive of Diener/Hauser/Bates, an advertising agency that was in New York. Her mother is the Democratic registrar of voters for the City of Stamford.

Laura Isabelle Weintraub, a daughter of Janet T. Weintraub of Stamford, Conn., and the late Henry M. Weintraub, was married last evening to Scott David Beck, a son of Vilma R. Beck of Monroe, Conn., and Gilbert A. Beck of Stamford. Rabbi Sharon L. Sobel officiated at Tappan Hill in Tarrytown, N.Y.

Mrs. Beck, 29, graduated from Trinity College in Hartford, received a master's degree in public policy from Harvard University and, in May, received a law degree from Columbia University. Next month she is to become an associate at Willkie Farr & Gallagher, the New York law firm. Her father was the president and chief executive of Diener/Hauser/Bates, an advertising agency that was in New York. Her mother is the Democratic registrar of voters for the City of Stamford.

Mr. Beck, 37, is a senior account executive in Fairfield, Conn., for SunGard Recovery Services, a computer disaster recovery business. He is also an owner of the Loft, a lounge, and Match, a restaurant, both in South Norwalk, Conn. He graduated from Southern Connecticut State University. His mother owns Paramount Resources, an employment agency in Westport, Conn. His father owns Sport-n-Life Distributors, a pet food and supply business in Stamford.
